alert_name: Suspicious Remote Assistance Tool Launch Following External Teams Contact
description: Cortex XDR detected critical security incident on workstation FIN-WKS-087 where user rbrown@financialcorp.com launched Microsoft Quick Assist remote assistance tool (quickassist.exe) 8 minutes after receiving external Microsoft Teams message from unverified 'IT Support' contact. Process telemetry shows quickassist.exe (C:\Windows\System32\quickassist.exe, PID 9247) launched via Windows Run dialog (parent process: explorer.exe PID 3891) at 03:58 AM, establishing outbound HTTPS connection to Microsoft Quick Assist relay servers (relay.support.services.microsoft.com, 20.190.160.1) for remote session initiation. Behavioral analysis identified suspicious session characteristics: (1) Launch timestamp 03:58 AM outside normal business hours, (2) No corresponding IT ticketing system entry for remote support request, (3) External Teams contact 'IT Support | External' not in corporate directory, (4) User manually entered 6-digit session code 734-892 received via Teams chat (clipboard monitoring detected code copy-paste from Teams.exe to quickassist.exe), (5) Session established with unknown remote party IP 103.224.182[.]45 (Singapore, bulletproof hosting ASN). EDR correlation shows temporal relationship: Teams message received 03:50 AM → User clicked phishing link 03:51 AM → QuickAssist downloaded 03:52 AM → Session code entered 03:58 AM → Remote connection established 03:59 AM. Quick Assist session granted attacker SYSTEM-level privileges via User Account Control (UAC) bypass (legitimate Quick Assist feature abuse), enabling full system control without additional exploits. Network forensics reveal session duration 47 minutes (03:59 AM - 04:46 AM), during which attacker downloaded multiple PowerShell scripts to %TEMP% directory. Behavioral Threat Protection flagged activity based on: RMM tool launch following external Teams contact, off-hours usage, lack of IT authorization, connection to suspicious foreign IP, unusual UAC elevation requests.
attack_mode: Legitimate RMM Abuse for Initial Access
policy_description: Quick Assist RMM launched following external Teams phishing - attacker gained remote SYSTEM access
policy_recommendation: CRITICAL: Terminate quickassist.exe PID 9247 immediately to end attacker session, isolate FIN-WKS-087 from network, force logout rbrown@financialcorp.com, review %TEMP% directory for attacker-dropped files (PowerShell scripts), check for persistence mechanisms (scheduled tasks, registry run keys, startup items), reset user credentials, implement Group Policy restricting Quick Assist to IT-only usage, enable logging for all RMM tool executions, hunt for similar Quick Assist launches following external Teams messages (XDR query: Teams.exe → quickassist.exe within 30 minutes), deploy behavioral rule detecting RMM tools launched outside IT-approved processes, forensic imaging required for full attack timeline reconstruction
log_source: Cortex XDR Agent - Behavioral Threat Protection
